datafield.subfield: Possible Evidence of Thermodynamic Equilibrium in Dark Matter Haloes
Possible Evidence of Thermodynamic Activity in Dark Matter Haloes
Possible Evidence of Thermodynamic Equilibrium in Dark Matter Haloes
34 pages, 37 figures. Version accepted for publication in the Astrophysical Journal

After deducing the density profiles and gravitational potential functions of eight galaxies from the rotation velocity data from THINGS, we find that the density decreases exponentially with the potential in substantial regions of the haloes. Such behavior is in agreement with that of a single-component isothermal Boltzmann gas, and suggests that an effective description in terms of a Boltzmann gas is possible for dark matter in these regions. This could be an indication that dark matter self-interactions are sufficient in strength and number to lead to thermal equilibrium in these regions. We write down the dynamics and boundary conditions for a Boltzmann gas description and examine some of its qualitative and quantitative consequences. Solutions to the dynamical system are determined by three dimensionfull parameters, and provide reasonable fits to the rotational velocity data in the regions where the Boltzmann-like behavior was found. Unlike in the usual approach to curve fitting, we do not assume a specific form for the dark matter density profile and we do not require a detailed knowledge of the baryonic content of the galaxy.
00011 Eight-parameter series fit of rotation velocity data for NGC 2403 from $r=.1$ to $24$ kpc.

00009 $\log{({\rm density/ constant})}$ versus the gravitational potential for NGC 2403 for $r=1$ to $24$ kpc. It is compared to a straight line (red, dashed) with slope $\approx -1.4\times 10^{-10}$ kg/J, which corresponds to $m/T\sim 1085$ eV/${}^o$K. The radial coordinate is restricted to $3<r<10$ kpc in the inset.
00028 Fitted values of $ M$ for NGC 2403 for values of $R_{\tiny {\tt G}}$ between $6.5$ and $10$ kpc.

00026 The results for the three-parameter fit of NGC 2403 rotation velocity data for $R_{\tiny {\tt G}}=6.5$ kpc are: $m/T=752$ eV$/^o$K, $\;\rho(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})=6.6\times 10^6 \; M_{\odot}/{\rm kpc}^3\;$ and $\;M(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})=2.39\times 10^{10}\; M_{\odot}$.
00029 Fitted values of $ \rho$ for NGC 2403 for values of $R_{\tiny {\tt G}}$ between $6.5$ and $10$ kpc.

00030 $\log[\rho(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})/\rho(r_0)]$ versus $\Phi(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})$ for $r_0\approx 6.5>R_{\tiny {\tt G}}>9$ kpc. It is compared to a straight line (red, dashed) with slope $\approx -1.01 \times 10^{-10}$ kg/J, which corresponds to ${m}/{T}\approx 786\; $eV/${}^o$K. The domain is restricted to $6.75<R_{\tiny {\tt G}}<8$ kpc in the inset.
00027 Fitted values of $ m/T$ for NGC 2403 for values of $R_{\tiny {\tt G}}$ between $6.5$ and $10$ kpc.
00000 Eight-parameter series fit of rotation velocity data for NGC 2841 from $r=3.8$ to $51.6$ kpc.

00003 $\log{({\rm density/ constant})}$ versus the gravitational potential for NGC 2841 for $r=3.8$ to $51.6$ kpc. It is compared to a straight line (red, dashed) with slope $\approx -2.46\times 10^{-11}$ kg/J, which corresponds to $m/T\sim 191$ eV/${}^o$K. The radial coordinate is restricted to $7<r<22$ kpc in the inset.
00001 Resulting gravitational potential versus $r$ for NGC 2841 from $r=3.8$ to $51.6$ kpc. The zero of the potential is at $r=3.8$.
00002 Resulting density versus $r$ for NGC 2841 from $r=3.8$ to $51.6$ kpc.
00013 Fitted values of $ M$ for NGC 2841 for values of $R_{\tiny {\tt G}}$ between $7.18$ and $15$ kpc.
00014 Fitted values of $ \rho$ for NGC 2841 for values of $R_{\tiny {\tt G}}$ between $7.18$ and $15$ kpc.

00015 $\log[\rho(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})/\rho(r_0)]$ versus $\Phi(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})$ for $r_0=7.18 >R_{\tiny {\tt G}}>15$ kpc. The slope is approximately $\approx -2.58 \times 10^{-11}$ kg/J, which corresponds to ${m}/{T}\approx 200\; $eV/${}^o$K.
00012 Fitted values of $ m/T$ for NGC 2841 for values of $R_{\tiny {\tt G}}$ between $7.18$ and $15$ kpc.

00010 The results for the three-parameter fit of NGC 2841 rotation velocity data for $R_{\tiny {\tt G}}=7.18$ kpc are: $m/T=193$ eV$/^o$K, $\;\rho(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})=4.2\times 10^7 \; M_{\odot}/{\rm kpc}^3\;$ and $\;M(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})=1.7\times 10^{11}\; M_{\odot}$ .

00011 The results for the three-parameter fit of NGC 2841 rotation velocity data for $R_{\tiny {\tt G}}=13.67$ kpc are: $m/T=180$ eV$/^o$K, $\;\rho(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})=7.15\times 10^6 \; M_{\odot}/{\rm kpc}^3\;$ and $\;M(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})=3.24\times 10^{11}\; M_{\odot}$.

00016 The results for the three-parameter fit of NGC 5055 rotation velocity data for $R_{\tiny {\tt G}}=6.47$ kpc are: $m/T=484$ eV$/^o$K, $\;\rho(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})=2.7\times 10^7 \; M_{\odot}/{\rm kpc}^3\;$ and $\;M(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})=6.05\times 10^{10}\; M_{\odot}$.
00023 Eight-parameter series fit of rotation velocity data for DD0 154 from $r= .3$ to $ 8$ kpc.

00024 $\log{({\rm density/ constant})}$ versus the gravitational potential for DD0 154 for $r=.3$ to $8$ kpc. It is compared to a straight line (red, dashed) with slope $\approx - 8600$ eV/Kel. The two plots approximately coincide for $1.5<r<4.5$ kpc.
00025 $\;\;-\frac{d\log{{\rm \rho}}}{d\phi}$ versus $r$ for DD0 154. The plot ranges between $\sim 7500$ eV/Kel and $\sim 10000$ eV/Kel over the domain $1.5<r<6.5$ kpc.

00036 Fit of the rotation velocity data for DD0 154 to a Boltzmann gas in the region $1. 5 \;{\rm kpc}\le r\le 6.5\;{\rm kpc}$. The fitted values for the three dimensionfull parameters of the Boltzmann gas are: $m/T\approx 7500$ eV/Kel, $\rho(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})\approx 1.2 \times 10^7 M_{\odot}/{\rm kpc}^3 $ and $M(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})\approx 3.4\times 10^{8} M_{\odot} $ .

00012 $\log{({\rm density/ constant})}$ versus the gravitational potential for NGC 2403 for $r=1$ to $20$ kpc. It is compared to a straight line (red, dashed) with slope $\approx -1100$ eV/Kel. The two plots approximately coincide for $3<r<10$ kpc.
00013 $\;\;-\frac{d\log{{\rm \rho}}}{d\phi}$ versus $r$ for NGC 2403. The plot is approximately constant over the domain $3<r<10$ kpc, which is shown in the inset.

00032 Fit of the rotation velocity data for NGC 2403 to a Boltzmann gas in the region $3 \;{\rm kpc}\le r\le 10\;{\rm kpc}$. The fitted values for the three dimensionfull parameters of the Boltzmann gas are: $m/T\approx 1140$ eV/Kel, $\rho(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})\approx 3.5 \times 10^7 M_{\odot}/{\rm kpc}^3 $ and $M(R_{\tiny {\tt G}})\approx 5.9 \times 10^{9} M_{\odot} $.

00026 $v/v_{x=1}$ is plotted versus $x$ for $\tau=\frac 12$ and $\kappa=0,\frac 16,\frac 13$ and $\frac 12$. The values of $\kappa$ are listed in ascending order of the slope at $x=1$, with $\kappa=0$ corresponding to no halo.

00027 $v/v_{x=1}$ is plotted versus $x$ for $\kappa=\frac 13$ and $\tau=\frac 14,\frac 12$ and $1$. The values of $\tau$ are listed in ascending order of the slope at $x=1$. The limiting value of $v/v_{x=1}$ is $\sqrt{2\tau}$, which is indicated for the top and bottom curves by the dashed gridlines.

00029 Plot of the Boltzmann gas density for the fitted values of the parameters (solid) compared to the density resulting from the eight-parameter series fit in section 2 which was obtained from the eight-parameter series fit restricted to the region $ 7 \;{\rm kpc}\le r\le 22\;{\rm kpc}$ (dashed).
